attributes.action: prosecute all MP's who are found guilty of false claims on expenses
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: all MP's should be dealt with under common law if they make false claims against the rules of their expense regime. That means they should be prosecuted, the same as all other members of the public, if they break the law.

rejection.details: Government cannot prosecute individuals or organisations. It is the role of the police to investigate suspected crimes, and the role of the Crown Prosecution Service to decide whether there is a case to answer, and to prosecute.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
